intro: Parasenecio albus, commonly known as the white parasenecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its most distinctive feature is the showy white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Parasenecio albus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it a common sight in coastal and mountainous regions.
